body_html:
@ebrevdo, I really disagree with you. If merge_repeated=True then it is exactly Graves' CTC and in case A B B * B * B firstly it merges repeated labels and make A B * B * B then it removes all blanks and our sequence become A B B B, not A B as in docs now. If it firstly remove all blanks and only then merge labels then we will never have two consecutive labels in a row which is not good and was not intended by Graves.

If I'm wrong, please prove it.
body_text:
@ebrevdo, I really disagree with you. If merge_repeated=True then it is exactly Graves' CTC and in case A B B * B * B firstly it merges repeated labels and make A B * B * B then it removes all blanks and our sequence become A B B B, not A B as in docs now. If it firstly remove all blanks and only then merge labels then we will never have two consecutive labels in a row which is not good and was not intended by Graves.
If I'm wrong, please prove it.
body:
@ebrevdo, I really disagree with you. If `merge_repeated=True` then it is exactly [Graves' CTC](http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~graves/icml_2006.pdf) and in case `A B B * B * B` firstly it merges repeated labels and make `A B * B * B` then it removes all blanks and our sequence become `A B B B`, not `A B` as in docs now. If it firstly remove all blanks and only then merge labels then we will never have two consecutive labels in a row which is not good and was not intended by Graves.

If I'm wrong, please prove it.
